yRzTafjPFplxouXIRTKbyA.text: Lovely!! This is such a beautiful and relaxing place. The atmosphere was perfect the food was also delicious! I am a fan of big breakfasts and this did not disappoint. Enough food so I didn't leave hungry, but not enough to where I had to find a fridge for my leftovers while at work. Just the perfect amount, I felt like Goldilocks right there! Haha!  I ordered the veggie omelette, they use seasonal veggies, this was onion, yellow squash and zucchini. The best treat of all was the goat cheese. I had forgotten after I placed my order that it had goat cheese, which is one of the reasons I ordered it. It was such a nice surprise! So much more savory than cheddar! The house potatoes were also delicious, simple and delicious! This was a such a pleasant place to go for my 37th birthday breakfast!

Fntlt2Ucbg8g8o8c433MsQ.text: Faboulous little hidden gem. I absolutely loved this cute breakfast outdoor cafe. Was so refreshing and breezy with beautiful farm setting. Will definatly be back here on my next visit to AZ. Their mimosas were yummy.

dFVp_mWBUM-u8ciO0rrdtA.text: I've been in the valley for 20 years and never knew this place existed at "The Farm" on 32nd Street just south of Southern.   Seating is all outside under large beautiful trees, lovely breeze this morning too, it was one of the most relaxing areas I've ever experienced and it was hard to believe that I was still in the city of Phoenix.   We were seated within 10 minutes and our server Carrie was great with answers to any questions we even brought us a menu from the restaurant adjacent Quiesscence and answered questions we had about that restaurant.   Now the food.  I had the chef special which was a braised beef and carmeralized onion omelette with potatoes.   My sister had the Eggs Benedict with the potatoes and of course, being family, we shared.  Everything was delicious and fresh.   After we ate we wandered around the farm and came across a small crowd and we were informed that the goat had two kids yesterday.   Just watching them brought a big grin to my face.   Next to the goat pen was the chicken pen.     It was just a lovely morning.

QScofAhl_1JAqs7FmR-6YA.text: Love the ambiance at this place. But when will the owners enforce the servers to be grateful they have a J-O-B? No smiles, no great customer service. The food takes FOREVER to get out to you. But if you wanna sit and wait 30 minutes or so for your food, then go. The food is tasty and it's nice to support a local biz. They should think about a little live music once a month on weekends.

WOP2_WeK50wPMLaFaLOVFA.text: I agree with Jessica F. I keep trying to love this place but there are other breakfast spots that I prefer -- save the ambiance. You really cannot beat The Farm setting.   The breakfast tacos are good but (and the menu description says this) they come in HARD taco shells.  Definitely consider this spot to kick off a romantic, relaxing day and for out of town guests.

kdSobTi1GxmDDbSwoF_Q0Q.text: Love this place!   Ate here with out of town guests.  I had been here years ago and forgot how nice it is.  Of course, over time they have really made it even nicer than I remembered.  Food great.  Atmosphere wonderful.   We went mid-week to avoid the crowds.  I'm sure this place must be mobbed on weekends.  I'm not a crowd person nor do I like waiting long for a table.  As such, I only go to places either very early in the day or on weekdays to avoid being frustrated as some posters have mentioned.  The crowds mentioned speak to the greatness of this place in my opinion.  Will go again in a couple of weeks with other guests.  Can't wait!

dd5GSaZcbA7TVOmnVNIe8A.text: Love this place.  The food is good too, but this dining is all about this setting.  Deep in the Walnut orchard under shady trees.  Sitting across from the one in your life.      It is 4 stars just because the service is getting a little weak.  I used feel like the people there were tip top, but this last visit they seemed to resting on their fact that everyone loves the setting.  They turned down the customer service thinking I wouldn't notice.    It is True, I did barely notice it, since I happen to be in love.  However, when you have a great server this place makes you feel like, you're dining in Oprah Winfreys' backyard during a big hat party!  Shimmering leaves, mimosas, amidst a organic garden, birds chirping, while couples in love and children frolic on the almond orchard horizon.    This place is great!  I feel like giving it 5 stars again now that I think about my times there.  This setting is so damn good.  I have to drive 15 miles to get here, and it is worth it.  However, I am going to keep it a 4 stars.  If I update, I am sure i will write this one a 5 star again

qGsGfYep9VohRIAE6SApsA.text: The Morning Glory Cafe is located at the far end of a very long drive through some really nice land at The Farm at South Mountain.  The area really takes you out of the city and makes you think there might not be civilization beyond the tall trees surrounding it.  It is a peaceful oasis in the midst of a bustling metropolis.  One note to save you some walking - as we approached the are on 32nd Street, there was a sign pointing right that said "Morning Glory Cafe" and a sign pointing left that said "Parking."  We turned left, parked, and walked down the long drive to the restaurant...where we found parking available for the restaurant.  Don't get tricked by the parking sign and park in the little lot across the street.  You can go down the drive and park closer to the restaurant itself.  The restaurant was fine overall; nothing terrible to talk about, but nothing amazing to talk about either.   The restaurant is outdoor seating only; there is no interior dining room so if you don't like to sit outside this probably isn't the best place for you.   One issue I encountered while we were there was that the trees (which there are a lot of all over) were dropping little leaves on us whenever the wind blew and they would land on our food.  The food itself was just okay.  It came out REALLY fast (and the restaurant was not slow that morning) which means that most of the food is prepped and ready to be nuked and served.  I had the "Cowboy Breakfast - Chili and Eggs" and it was a bowl of chili with two over-easy eggs on top.  Nothing fancy, just that.  Definitely not a lot of thought toward presentation or elegance - and, I get it, I ordered the Cowboy breakfast on a farm I shouldn't expect French Laundry... but, based on that dish and my overall experience, I don't think I'll be going back and if I did I wouldn't order the Cowboy Breakfast again.  There just wasn't anything interesting or special about it.  It really struck me as a turn-and-burn dish.  The beverage setup was a little strange, but I actually didn't totally mind it.  Coffee, tea, water, and lemonade are self serve up at the counter and the server just counts your cups at the end of the meal.  One positive to being able to fill my own drink was that it was never empty because I didn't need to wait for our server to stop by the table for refills.  Speaking of servers, we didn't end up leaving that much of a tip because when you arrive, you find your own table and you get your own drinks.  The server stopped by the take our order and dropped off our food.  Other than that, we didn't see her until she brought the check over.  Honestly, I did half of the work myself by getting my drinks so we didn't feel like a large (or even normal) tip was necessary.  Overall, Morning Glory Cafe was alright, but I have better restaurants to spend my time in.

PTsP3zmoCpzPN_cIplBYzg.text: A perfect place for a lazy Sunday morning breakfast! I had the Chef's special which was an asparagus and swiss omelet with a red pepper cream sauce. To die for yummy! The little biscuits and home-fries served with it were delicious too!   My boyfriend had the chicken enchilada and loved it.   Our only criticism would be for the drinks. He had a Bloody Mary. The drinks were premade so they could not customize. He said there was too much pepper and not enough Worcestershire.   They don't serve any pop either. Pop is my caffeine fix of choice so that was a bit of a bummer.   Service was good and it was fun to walk around the property while we waited for our table.

0o0sDVk4zzKPtYNBTryd3A.text: We were staying at the Legacy Golf Resorts during Christmas break, and decided to get some brunch.  I booted up my trusty Yelp App, and a quick search yielded this place a mere 30 second drive away.  This is just an awesome brunch spot.  A lot of the ingredients seemed very fresh and delicious.  I got the breakfast burritos which came loaded with rich, delicious chorizo, eggs, and beans, while my girlfriend got the waffles.  The waffles came with the sweetest blackberries I've ever eaten (although the strawberries were not sweet).  Love the atmosphere, service, and the food.  What can be better than sitting outside surrounded by the farm, enjoying fresh coffee and brunch?  Life is good!

SXk8JIDTSf2PqsrSQFj-Hg.text: Cool spot but not organic enough. Just kidding, check it out and you will understand.

6g9uehibRSBNVaJGYmzBHQ.text: I wish i could give half stars, for me this is a 3.5 star place.  The location for morning glory is really nice.  Like everyone said, it is set on a farm and quiet.  It is all outdoor seating which was nice.  There were outdoor heaters set up so it wasn't cold.   Everything is suppose to be organic, which I'm sure it was.  I can't tell the difference from real food and organic, I just like what taste good.  The food did taste good, but it wasn't anything special for me.     I had the American breakfast.  Bacon tasted like bacon should.  Same with the eggs.  Came with baked potatoes which were ok, kind of bland.  There was no salt or pepper on the table.   The wife had a monte Cristo.  That was good.  It used their French toast which by itself was good and as a sandwich was good.  You can't go wrong with that.

fK9T5cU0zXGbcSzagtffyw.text: Beautiful country setting in Phoenix on an old farm. Watch closely because it is easy to miss as it is actually an old farm near the Legacy Golf resort at South Mountain.  Very good home made breakfast with fresh ingredients from the farm.  Orange juice was fresh and tasty.  Eggs and bacon were very good. Biscuits and gravy were excellent.  The setting was the star of this breakfast! I would recommend ! You won't be sorry !

JI7-274ZqJg29KJiyc78gg.text: This place is a hidden gem!!  Everything on the menu looked SO good.... I couldn't decide. Sooooo I got the following:  French Toast (Sweet Rustic Bread, Apple Butter, Candied Pecans and Warm Syrup)  + Side of 1 egg and a side of applewood smoked Bacon (3 Slices)   The french toast came out with 3 THICK slices of bread, a TON of apple butter and a sprinkling of pecans. While the bread was fresh and soft... it didnt really have much flavor... I like my french toast to be more cinnamony... Plus, there was just TOO MUCH butter and not enough pecans.  The bacon was MONEY!! It was peppered (which I LOVE) and cooked perfectly.   My friend got the blueberry Belgian waffle which she swapped 1/2 for 1/2 of my french toast.  The waffle was probably the best thing there.... light and fluffy with WHOLE blueberries in it... YUM.  Also, my other friend's meal came with a biscuit and "home fries" which she let me try. The biscuit was warm and fresh out of the oven but a bit too dense for my taste... the "home fries" are actually just seasoned and slightly mashed up potatoes... they were REALLY good... spicy and very flavorful. I wish I had ordered some!!   I also got a glass of fresh squeeze orange juice. DELICIOUS!!!   The food here is great, but what really makes this place a hit is the ambiance... the little tables under the shade of the trees and the farmy, rustic feel.   GO HERE!!

4aWQRhvxCgMjvTu0CYBQOg.text: Took one look at me and seated us by the restrooms.  I expected that.  Eh.  The food was delivered quickly, the waitress was on point and I enjoyed my Eggs Benedict.  It is Oct  so eating outdoors is perfect.  Really liked this place.

ZGGyrKvjTtscdauLKN_GIw.text: I liked my breakfast and so did my partner but I do find the "help yourself to lemonaide or ice tea or water" a bit misleading.  I saw the sign that it was 2.75, but I dont think a lot of people do so they end up paying for drinks they think are free.  I had an egg white omelette with mushrooms, mozzarella and marinara sauce.  The home fries were good and the biscuit was tasty( although small).  My partner had the classic american breakfast and it was advertised as 2 eggs, but seemed like a lot more.  We ordered a muffin that was tasty but once again I had an issue.  The menu said 2.50, but we were charged 2.95.  The mistake was fixed once I pointed it out, but how often has that happened?

6LVnOD4JRJw1PMW06AwiMw.text: Enjoyed the Healthy food options. Love the outdoor atmosphere. Would definitely go back!

coGwfyF0HvSWM1yeRfXZUw.text: The scenery was absolutely beautiful, the customer service was fun and had our food out in a timely manner. And for an outdoor area somehow they've managed to keep a majority of the flys and bees away, definitely a plus. Otherwise the food was fantastic, perfect portion for breakfast and all around delicious. Will definitely be back.

mkBcGzdVRMIluECu1N9F9w.text: A quite delicious breakfast/brunch spot with outstanding fresh food.  Mimosas are very good, bloody Marys are a little heavy on the horseradish for my liking. Coffee is ok.  Outdoor seating only and out door heating for chilly mornings.  If you're in the mood for a nice breakfast nook of a spot with "can't go wrong" dishes, this is a place to be.

4opZPb7klUySR62CV14bng.text: Love this place, it's such a hidden gem in Phoenix. Take the dogs, kids and a picnic blanket to hang out on the lawn under the trees after you're done eating a tasty brunch in the cooler months. Love that they've kept a simple menu and just focused on honoring their beautiful space in the middle of the city.

FcgdJAsGYUlTH3D9k5riaw.text: Morning Glory Cafe is a hidden gem in the middle of south Phoenix.  While sitting in the cafe or garden waiting to be seated (it can be a while) the sounds of bird song fills the air and enticing aromas from the kitchen flow by teasing your nose and creating thoughts on what culinary delights will soon be filling your belly.    The service has always been exceptional and the servers will always make sure you have a good experience.  One person that stands out in my mind as an example of how to keep things running smoothly is Cliff, he is the best!  He keeps the place cruising along at an unhurried, yet efficient pace with a calmness that is at the core of the experience The Farm offers.    Give it a try if you haven't and keep coming back if you have.  This place is great for biking, bringing your well behaved dogs and just spending some quality time with family or friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CMAWz9R5zFavuTYSkxV8lg.text: Cant say enough good things about The Morning Glory Cafe. The entire experience was a success all the way from the friendly staff and excellent dining to the surrounding environment.   The food here is made to order and I am almost certain that most of the ingredients used comes right from the family farm (which you're allowed to explore). I advise that you arrive here early because it does get crowded, especially on the weekends. Everything I ate tasted so fresh and I had such a hard time deciding what to order because all the food looked/sounded so good! Make sure you make your way to the Morning Glory Cafe so you can see how they are taking "farm fresh food" to the next level.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LQgQm958Wa8MJOeNsEdUdQ.text: It is indeed wise to close the patio for the summer, but we will be back when Morning Glory reopens in September to see if we can nudge this 3-star review any higher.   When you set foot in the Farm at South Mountain, you just want to love the place. It is an active farm with gardeners tending to the rows of flowers and vegetables, a magnificent walk to the patio and shops, and my personal favorite, the chicken coop! Lots of chickens scurrying about and bickering with each other.   From time to time you will also notice social events and outdoorsy activities (such as yoga classes, musical recitals, etc.) taking place on the expansive lawn. The grounds are enormous; perfect for a light stroll after you've had your breakfast. Fitting then for this farm to present Morning Glory Cafe, with its exclusively outdoor seating and colorful view of the garden.   The first time I visited (Sept. 2017), I think I was so mesmerized by the plants that I forgot to give much consideration to the food! My meal was undoubtedly good though, so I left with the sole intention to return.   Since coming back, and these times with more and more company, a few things have shifted into focus:   With my respects to Cortez coffee, it is not worth ~$3 to make however many trips you need to the beverage station. In fact, I do not much like that setup at all. A line often accumulates, drinks do run out, and if not, you are likely to dispense old coffee that's been sloshing around for whatever length of time.   Given the proud farm-to-table vittles, the "local sausage" initially struck me as a must-try; you can get it as a side to your American Breakfast (classic eggs + meat combo), an omelet add-in, or a standalone plate. But oh my, how very dry.... the ~$4 for our sausage became a table centerpiece, as enduring the dry chewiness was not worth the effort.  These complaints out of the way, it ought to be noted that they do vegetables well over here, and are we really surprised by that? The fresh vegetable medleys add nicely to any dish, and while we're at it, the eggs and toast are good too.   In all, Morning Glory is A-OK; you get breakfast with your scenery (or scenery with your breakfast; depends on your outlook). I do recommend them, but on the same note, I would strongly recommend having coffee before or after breakfast, and order the bacon too. If the weather is agreeable, do take in the garden after your meal. If nothing else, that is sure to be a relaxing and enjoyable experience.   Til September, Morning Glory.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros (front), and the special Benedict (back). Take a look at those vegetables.

MHo54Y1U421PgLRVS8UHbQ.text: Really great food, fun friendly staff, and a beautiful peaceful location. Tried the brioche French toast. So. Good. The weather was beautiful so sitting outside was bearable. I am looking forward to coming back with my family!

Z0Kxuxf27EMvVFg8Q69dKQ.text: We absolutely love coming to The Farm and dining at the Morning Glory Cafe. Yes, on a weekend, specifically Sunday, you are going to wait..and wait..and wait. Slow down! It's the weekend! Enjoy a slow day and the scenery. The farm is beautiful. The gift shop is sweet. Homer the tortoise and his chicken friends are always excited to have friends say hi while you wait for your name to be called. There are plenty of places to sit and relax until it's your turn to dine. The service in the cafe is FAST! The food is fresh and delicious. I can never pass up some fresh OJ. So go here on a leisurely day and relax. Then stop by the bistro up front on your way out for something sweet.

Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

APvFxQmzw7FkDpk30SkD4Q.text: 4.5 stars. You can't find places like this where I live in San Francisco! So, so cute. Driving through beautiful green pastures to find Morning Glory gave me FOMO for all the other eateries I wouldn't have time to visit in one trip. And I regret not bringing my husky puppy to AZ with me.  At Morning Glory, coffee is self-served, but a waitress comes by to take your food order. I got the classic eggs benedict because it's a pretty good benchmark for brunch places. I wish I wasn't going straight to work right after because the Bloody Mary looked delicious.  The eggs benedict was tasty, and my friend loved her dish too. Everything is so lush and Pinterest-worthy, from the food to the decor. It was surprisingly empty for a popular weekend brunch time, which was good for us. I like that the benches are squished together, leaving plenty of room for large groups and their animal companions.  Overall I'm happy with my experience at Morning Glory. Usually I don't like to repeat eateries when I'm traveling, but I'd be down to come here again. AZ always surprises me with its incredible food and amazing sights. This place is no exception.

m1sYnp-22U_ReQdMK13FEA.text: I had a weird experience at Morning Glory Cafe recently. The farm is normally such a pretty and peaceful place. However, on this Saturday morning, we were sat next to a very rowdy table. They were clearly drunk when we arrived. They had finished their meals but were continuing to drink. They were so loud. After a while, I couldn't take it anymore and asked to be moved. I explained to the server, who was also their server, that they were too noisy and intoxicated. She was very kind about moving us. Our new table was still within view, but much quieter. Unfortunately, this story doesn't end there. They ordered at least three more rounds of mimosas and continued to drink until one of them puked all over the table. What a pretty sight for breakfast...  I would like to chalk this experience up to bad guests, but the server was just as much at fault. They had been clearly over-served long before the vomit.  Also, the food was bland and lacked any sort of flavor. My friend and I both ordered from the "South of the Border" section of the menu but we had to douse our food in hot sauce to make it taste like anything that would be close to Mexican food.

dk-SplzGeyuh-mp5oQWN_w.text: This cafe is in the Farm at South Mountain which is such a cute place! My friend and I hiked a trail on South Mountain last weekend and wanted to find a place to eat brunch afterwards and stumbled upon this place. Beware, this restaurant is very very busy (at least on weekends, which was when we visited). We waited over an hour to be seated, but in my opinion, it was worth the wait. There is a lot to do around the restaurant: a big area to walk around and chairs/tables outside to sit and chat at.  The food was also delicious and the portions were generous. I ordered the farm burrito and my friend ordered the farm monte cristo. I really enjoyed my breakfast burrito and the salsa was the perfect complement. My friend enjoyed her meal as well, but said that it was a little heavy for her tastes. If you're looking for a cute place for brunch that serves good food and has great service, this is a great place to check out!

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Farm burrito

aOZMVMcW7NpXHB8nSrdqFQ.text: Food is great and fresh. Outdoor seating and feels more like you are at a friend's house than a restaurant. Self serve beverage which includes, coffee, tea, water and juices.  It appears they give you a slice of grapefruit with your order.  We had a lovely time with relaxed atmosphere. Parking spot could be a little difficult to find during peak hours. I would advice you come a little early or give yourself plenty of time.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1qI2kRtF7Fd2aL_SvizE-Q.text: We went for brunch on Saturday as a group of eight (plus my Corgi), and I was delighted with my entire experience. They don't take reservations, and when we got there we were told the wait would be an hour. For a Saturday morning I wasn't surprised, I feel like you'd have a hard time finding a brunch place with a shorter wait in most parts of the Valley. Luckily, since we were such a large group there were only so many tables that could accommodate us and one opened up within 15 minutes!   In the 15 minutes we waited we grabbed coffee from the coffee cart and mimosas from the hostess table, listened to the live music, explored the gardens, and checked out the local businesses that had booths. We even got to watch weddings get set up and one happen!   They were busy but our orders were taken quickly and our food brought out in record time. Our waitress seemed spread thin, so it was hard to get the one set of silverware we were missing, but it all happened in time. The food was great, everyone in our group loved what they ordered. It's hard to beat fresh ingredients that come straight from the farm that surrounds you as you eat. If you're going with a group, take note that there's no splitting of checks, but thank goodness for Venmo!   There are giant shade trees that kept us cool in the beautiful April weather, and the entire place had such a relaxed and happy environment. I would've loved to hang out there all day.  I had heard people talk about the Farm at South Mountain for years while I lived in the Valley, and am so glad I finally went!

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YJSf_qtl8eIotwjzc3OKlg.text: It was quite a glorious morning the day we went to Morning Glory Cafe. The air was crisp and cool, and since we ate here on a weekday there was plenty of seating available. I love the atmosphere of The Farm at South Mountain but had always eaten at The Kitchen so it was on my checklist to try out this breakfast spot.  I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo. It was a huge portion, filled with fluffy eggs, potatoes, chorizo, refried tepary beans, cheese and pico de gallo. All the components worked well together, and while I enjoyed the addition of chorizo, I'd probably skip it for next time since it was an additional $2.50 on top of my already pricey $12.95 burrito. The plate also had sour cream, mild salsa, potatoes, and a slice of grapefruit.   We brought the pups along since it's a dog friendly venue. They enjoyed hanging out and taking in all the sights at the farm. They have some mega chickens here that are larger than my dogs. Tricki was very intrigued!

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito with chorizo
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles with chorizo
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog friendly! Tricki heard someone say breakfast burrito.

9UP1ZVUyJJgBiX0lP9TSPw.text: This was the best place I ate on our entire trip in Arizona! This place is so beautiful, I wish I could live here! The food was delicious and the service was great! If I come back to Phoenix I will definitely eat here again. I wish we had a place like this back at home. I loved wondering the farm once we finished eating, it was so quiet and peaceful! The prices we're a bit high, but the food quality was amazing and the food was local. Since it's a farm I do wish you could eliminate the use of plastic!!

t7C20VdIiMzo0YQCSGYHoA.text: Absolutely adore this place! I always want to go whenever I'm in town cause it's just picture perfect. I've been to the farm for lunch before and morning glory was the best farm to table breakfast.   I had the waffles with fresh berries. The waffle was light and airy and just a touch of sweetness with the berries and syrup. The breakfast sandwiches were delicious! Great portions and love the self serve coffee bar.   Service was great. Beautiful view of the farm and love the outdoor seating of the picnic tables to take it all in. A perfect way to start the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Light and fluffy waffles
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BrebmxbnL_ZMai8ECqkczg.text: This is easily one of my FAVORITE places to eat & be!  I recommend everyone visit here at least once!  A beautiful farm (garden, not too many animals) that uses their harvest in the dishes.  This place is extremely beautiful, relaxing, and delicious!  I've ordered their granola, French toast, and the Pork is the New Black omelet over and again!  Every time has been delicious, we even took a bag of granola home!  They use the pecans from their trees and it's perfect!  The omelet is served with a gravy, bisquit, and potatoes.  Soooooo good!   The service is always great, even when they are super busy and have a 30 minute wait time.   The bathrooms... are not what'd I'd prefer, but they are decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids French Toast
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love!
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork is the New Black

f_91ocdjssW4Clhhgvw3Lg.text: This is inside The Farm at South Mountain. It's an adorable outdoor restaurant but the food was just okay.  For me, it's more of the atmosphere that you are paying for.  I had the "B.E.S.T" Breakfast sandwich which consisted of Toasted sandwich with applewood smoked bacon, Hickman Farm eggs (any style), spinach, tomato, Gruyere cheese and mayo. Served with Farm home fries.  The sandwich was actually quite bland and I decided to switch with my husband who ordered the Chilaquiles which consisted of Crisp tortillas with housemade roasted red and tomatillo salsas, two fried eggs, melted cheese, pico de gallo and crema.  I took a bite of that and didn't like it either so I went back to my sandwich.  My parents split a chorizo burrito and that was quite tasty.  If I ever come back, that is what I would order.  The 'serve yourself' drink area was a little deceiving as there is a tiny sign hanging above the area that stated the drinks were $3.25 (free refills).  They don't mention this when they tell you that you can help yourself to tea, coffee, water and lemonade at the beginning when you are seated.  I didn't realize that until the very end when we received our bill.  My toddler didn't drink anything from there as we brought his own milk and juice bottles but he was charged anyway.  Again, the atmosphere was great and my kids enjoyed running around afterwards.

p7CZWrp4d32aHw3rHRgSnQ.text: This place is so cute! Looking to beat the rush?? Come on a weekday, Sunday's wait time was an hour! But if you've got the time wait it out, it's worth it.   Food is excellent! It's fresh and tastes homemade. It's like eating breakfast at grandmas. The atmosphere is super cute, and perfect for those looking for a picturesque (instagramable) breakfast spot (outdoor seating). If you're there on a weekday and it's not crowded it's incredibly serene and peaceful. The service is fantastic, some of the friendliest staff!

DNrPKd_HBRffIv04S3sBOw.text: Not easy to find. It is actually part of "The Farm" at south mountain. Stopped at this place this morning and it was closed. So much for breakfast. I will have to go somewhere else.

Bpga5gNbVXKqBBYUwHwYfg.text: What a unique and scenic place to dine in Phoenix! Definitely not your typical Arizona desert landscape. I've been here twice now and I think it will be a go-to spot, in the non-summer months, to bring out-of-state guests. Reminds me of a Cali vineyard - so I think it's kind of cool to show visitors that places like this exist here in the Valley.  The first time you come here it can be a bit tricky to find because you have to pull in and drive all the way back the the dirt road to the gravel parking lot. Once you park, you can walk down to the cafe. The cafe has all outdoor seating so don't expect AC or any other indoor accommodations. I've never used their restrooms so I'm not sure what they are like or even where they are located. They do have lots of shaded tables but it still gets hot so I really recommend coming as early as possible. On my most recent visit, we arrived at 9:30am and by the time we left around 10:30/11am it was already pretty hot! (It's May.) Because of this, their hours of operation are very limited and they close early (11am on weekdays and 1pm on weekends).  Delicious sweet and savory breakfast options. Talk about fresh, this is legit farm to table dining as I believe they even get their eggs from the chicken coop which you have a direct view of at your table. You can even walk over and check out the coop if you so desire (I haven't yet).  Self serve water, coffee, juice in coolers at a little station. In terms of the food, I've only tried savory items but next time I plan to splurge and try one of their sweet dishes.  Both times I've dined here early on a weekday so it wasn't busy and there was no wait. I've heard it gets busy on weekends. The service was pretty good but also not super speedy either time. I think this is the kind of place you're expected to sit, chill, enjoy the scenery, and maybe leisurely catch up with someone. Not a place to come if you're in a rush.  It says it's child friendly but I'd be reluctant to bring my toddler: a.) because of the sun and heat; and b.) because I can almost guarantee they'd want to run through the garden and fields - which is probably ok with management (?) but would most definitely result in a dirt fest. Then again, I am reluctant to dine out with my toddler just about anywhere!  I dream of hosting (or at the very least attending) an event here on The Farm at South Mountain's gorgeous grounds. I'm going to go ahead and add that to my bucket list!   Come here if you want to escape the desert and experience a unique farm to table breakfast.

UXZgfLjjXAmDtunsAPk15Q.text: If I was rating the food alone, I would give them 4 stars. But unfortunately the service we experienced was horrible.   I ordered the smoked trout board and subbed roasted veggies instead of the bagel. My dish was wonderful and I'd highly recommend it.   The service, however, will keep me from returning.   We expected to wait before we arrived, so that was no surprise. We had a party of 6 and a baby, which is already difficult with a restaurant that doesn't take reservations, and Morning Glory tends to run long wait times. We made the best of it and enjoyed some mimosas while wandering around the grounds and enjoying each other's company.   They gave away the first table to a group who had been waiting for less time than us. Once we got to our table, it felt like we were an afterthought to our server. She rarely checked on us and didn't seem to care about our experience. The food took a very long time to come out, some of which didn't actually ever come out, and then our bill took over a half hour. They tacked on automatic 20% gratuity, which we felt was a bit absurd considering our experience  If you're thinking of coming here for brunch, consider going elsewhere or just ordering takeout instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grapefruit mimosa
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smoked trout with veggies instead of a bagel

QDMlyFIsn1e01fXFJlJQ2g.text: My friend and I went at approximately 10am on a Saturday, there was a 15 minute wait however it did not take too long. We explored the cute little shop they had while we waited. Getting our breakfast was not a long wait and there is self serve water, coffee and lemonade. I got the French toast with bacon and my friend got the monte cristo. I did feel like they put a tad bit too much syrup, next time I will ask for it on the side. Other than that the food was amazing. The waiter we had encouraged us to explore the farm which was really cool. They have pet chickens for adoptions and a big tortoise! It's definitely a nice area for a morning stroll especially after breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homer!
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brioche French toast, bacon, farm monte cristo, Bloody Mary and a mimosa.

LhIY7I85pa2bvSxYAshgTw.text: Ok, so Morning Glory is further past the "Kitchen" most people were walking down the pathway. The lemonade and ice tea options are awful, don't waste your time on the free refills for $3.50. The drinks to order was also around the same price, but much better. We ordered OJ and Cranberry Juice. Eggs Benedict and Trout omelet. Both came with home potatoes which were good and a biscuit. Jam was real strawberries. Yum!  I gave a 4 star because I ordered the peppers to the side but they didn't even deliver those and the waitress was gone so long by time she came I had already eaten much of my meal. She didn't even offer to bring then, even at that time, which seemed rude since they come with the meal.   Good place to eat, just a few service items could improve.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trout omelet with home fries
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict with home fries
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oZsMX5WQxzmOEB6eZiZx0Q.text: Loved this place, it is so quaint.  We happen to be in the neighborhood and i've always wanted to try this place.  The grounds are beautiful with huge grassy areas, picnic tables, huge gardens, etc.  We had breakfast here.  I had the South Mountain omelet with goat cheese and sauteed vegetables from their garden (zucchini, red pepper, onion, fennel, cauliflower).  You can not get more farm to table than this place.   My boyfriend had eggs benedict and he said the sauce was the best he has ever had - very rich.  He said the sauteed greens on the benedict was a nice touch.  It's very casual and it was packed.  I definitely want to try the dinner restaurant, Quintessa?   It is expensive but would be such a great experience.  They said he butchers his own meat and flies in fresh seafood every day.   Yummy!

Zon7KuS5BpzI3cDxAouKqQ.text: This little cafe located towards the back of The Farm at South Mountain is to die for. All normal lawn chairs, nothing fancy. It's under a huge tree that gives shade to the entire outdoor restaurant. I love seeing all the vegetables that they planted because they take those veggies and use it for their different dish. Such a cute little place with mouth watering, fresh, organic, veggies right from the garden. Love love love!

FIuZShkRx3qpr_B0P6g4EQ.text: What a fun place to go to for breakfast.  My husband and I took my uncle here for breakfast a couple of weeks ago.  It is a beautiful place to go to.  You definitely do not fill like you are in Arizona when you are at the Cafe.   One of the cool thing about the cafe was that you could get your own drink whenever you wanted to.  The staff was great and the food was amazing too.  I had the pork in the new black omelet.  O my,  it was the best omelet I have had in a really long time.    If you have guest coming into town and trying to decide where to go.  You should take them to Morning Glory Cafe.

sGEMEoOgXs48BsNgQayjCw.text: Morning Glory isn't cheap but it's delicious, fresh, organic, local food and totally worth! I went on recommendation of a coworker and was not let down. I had the Monte Cristo and....wow. the brioche french toast was incredible and the egg and everything else was perfectly cooked. the wait time was well over an hour (perhaps because we went on Valentine's Day???) but it was definitely worth it! And as an awesome extra bonus: their coffee cups/lids are compostable!

Ftdkhg0NwHSmyM_59VBPyA.text: I was on vacation and found this beautiful ranch, I had their delicious soft airy waffle with eggs & bacon and a mimosa. It was all perfect with shops around while you wait and nice people. A fun place to be.

4vM-KscoBu9YPk1Wd6K3IA.text: Absolutely AWFUL service this morning. We have been here many times before and it had always been an enjoyable experience, but this morning was just so awful. Our server was slow and unsure of every little thing. Getting drinks took far too long, food orders were incorrect or forgotten entirely, at no point in our meal did our server ask how things were or check on us. I will not frequent this establishment in the future nor will I recommend this cafe to to anyone else. Completely dissatisfied.

YixITn-WAcFv9TJcpWZL0Q.text: YUM YUM YUM and $$$ i don't feel that i need to say much else.  except get the monte cristo, the bacon and french toast and more bacon is amazing.

00Tk1qUXskK_9HIFODQbbw.text: This place is amazing on the weekend although it is busy. The weekday barely anyone is there but the service is kind of weak which you would think it wouldnt be since the employees have nothing else to do. The food is good but everytime we ask for our eggs for be fried or over easy they cone out really runny and sunny side up. Overall you are paying mostly for the environment and the freshness of some of the food. :) I enjoyed the place and I will return agian. :3

Px8_BMG9QUQP6934JRUdHA.text: The food is great but the price is high. I absolutely LOVED the Eggs Benedict. The Monte Cristo was delicious; would have been better with potatoes. Nice ambience. It was cool and the birds were chirping. I'll be back!

u9MzkFMr3Y6VBROzRSS-Yw.text: Waiter stole from us. My self and my spouse ate at morning glory 5/28, the service was horrible. Wrote a $2.00 tip, I kept the receipt just to make sure the correct amount went through. The waiter Alexandra decided she was owed more and gave herself a $6.00 tip instead of what I wrote in. I have called with no answer or response to this egregious thief by one of their employees. Be wary of eating here for the staff may steal from you.

6VP0SoH-s2QYKaz6QAmL7A.text: Very cute restaurant, very relaxed. I had the breakfast burrito, which was delicious. The bloody mary was also extremely good. I really enjoyed the atmosphere - the area was beautiful and it was extremely relaxing.  The coffee was good and it was nice to be able to just head over and fill up whenever you needed it.

lJ8ANnEnyHPpvCoYwze3wQ.text: Excellent locally sourced food. I ordered the delicious breakfast burrito which was too big for me to finish. The ambiance is amazing as you sit under large mesquite trees in a very welcoming environment. There is only seating outside, but they have a number of outdoor heaters to keep you warm. In the late Spring and Summer, I'm sure the shade trees make it a nice reprieve from the heat. The staff is very friendly and accommodating making suggestions on drinks and menu items. I like the self-serve drink stations so that you don't have to wait for coffee. If you're visiting Phoenix, don't miss this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside dining under the trees.

0Y2dSGJMiP4txPSEaPrcoA.text: I really struggled between 3 and 4 stars for this. The farm is awesome and it was a perfect day. We came here for a baby shower/brunch and were able to sit in the back on the grass. Everyone was excited we got some sun and were able to sit outside in February with such great weather.   We recognized the restaurant was busy, and no one was in a rush, but it seemed like our waitress couldn't handle the stress of brunch as well as having a larger party. I know I can be pretty harsh when it comes to serving, but when you spend over 10 years doing it yourself, you know how things could and should be done.  We had the menu in front of us for not even a minute and she was asking what we wanted to order. No drink order...no introduction...nothing. I had to prompt her that we were good to order drinks first -it being brunch and all we mostly opted for bloody's and mimosas. The bloody was good and refreshing. Not my favorite that I have had around, but not bad. Mimosas were good sized and had freshly squeezed OJ.   When we finally did decide to order, we kept it pretty basic. The menu isn't extensive so that's easy. We all had a variety of things including the American breakfast which was nice and simple with a great little biscuit. Someone had the biscuits and gravy as well as the hash and others had the waffles and other stuff. Generally, for taste, everything was good, but it was cold on our half of the table. Having waited a bit, we all just kind of ate and commented that although it was good cold, it would have been awesome hot. The people who had hot plates had nothing to complain about.   Getting the food was another story though -that took quite a while which made it annoying that some plates were cold and others were hot. If you knew you had to bring it out as it came, then I would rather one person have a hot meal and me have to wait for my hot meal as well.   Now this is where I am a bit more sympathetic: having to split a bill. Some tables can be really annoying and make it a tedious task. Generally POS systems make it fairly easy to split things off of the main bill (if they did 10 years ago, then there's no reason it shouldn't be even better these days!). We asked to have our bill split because she didn't do it from the start. Someone even asked her to make sure she did it from the beginning so we could avoid this at the end. She went around and wrote down what each person or couple had and it took FOREVER to get the bills back. No worries for the most part as we enjoyed being outside but still. Once we got them, they still weren't split correctly! At this point we each just paid whatever piece of paper we had in our hands. Luckily gratuity was already added-but it was 20% right off the bat (FYI).  The silver lining, I guess, was that our waitress also over ordered for our table so we got a free farm omlet which was yummy and a free mimosa.   I was SO excited about this place so I know I need to go back and try it again. Plus they offer so much else as far as dinner or snacks. The hype has to be genuine right?

h8S_d0gWWkXtFBNEJFtizg.text: Based on all the positive reviews I was looking forward to having my birthday brunch here.  In the end, it was quite a disappointment.  We had a reservation for 10 people, plus two infants.  When we arrived, on time, they had given our table to a walk-in party of 11 and told us we would need to wait.  After asking to speak with the manager and several conversations later, plus 30minutes of waiting, they tried to seat us at an 8-top.  There was no way we would all fit, so after all this, they dragged another table over so we could all comfortably sit.   The waitress was nice and it wasn't her fault, but other than that, the experience was not a good one.  The food was mediocre at best, they charged us for the drinks (coffee, lemonade and tea) that they have set up and tell you to help yourself but never mention the price!  The owner was there and knew what had happened with our reservation and never said a word to us.  All in all, I would NOT recommend this place at all!  Sad, because the location is beautiful.

o4VYiL443m2yjpIBhQw1QA.text: Service was good, weather was great.. That's cuz it's November! Coffee could be better and the omelette was decent. I was really looking forward to this place being all that it was suppose to be, but it was a little bit of a let down :( ... I'm not one to bash but the food coulda been a little better, omelette didn't have much flavor, potatoes were a little salty, and the French toast was a little rubbery... Over all the place is nice you can't complain when you have Arizona winter weather, while most are in snow jackets and boots I'm wearing t-shirts and shorts ... ;-)  I'll Probably won't be back but it was a nice experience, I'll most likely be at the Waffle House next weekend. Lol... I sure do miss the Grove Cafe - it's closed but they are having a charity event Dec 14 for Salvation Army Christmas Angels - 100% of the proceeds go to the charity! Now that's sweet!!

9phKV7nWOGnsONXUuKpciA.text: This place is amazing. When the weather is cool, this outdoor place is perfect. The food is great, I love the Money Cristo. And the baked goods are delish. Great brunch spot. And you can play corn hole in one of the open areas!

-2vL7GPJtTF9kSsYvO2B0Q.text: Lovely ambience and delicious food .. Perfect for weekend brunches , lush green grass , trees , chirping birds and great food ..

5paa3lYQdcneb9B3fmUF1g.text: Feeling like breakfast on a farm? This is the place.  The scenery is picturesque.  I heard birds singing in the trees, horses neighing in the background & the sun was shining through the trees.  WHAT.  WHERE AM I.  This is not the South Mountain I am used to... thankfully.  This place is a little escape... a farm oasis in the middle of the desert.  Me gusta.  i had the South Mountain Omelette.  It had lots of tasty seasonal veggies, goat cheese & a little zing of green chile sauce.  I also opted for the seasonal fruit... glad I did.  Everything was so fresh.  I left feeling satisfied & happy, not overly stuffed like I do at most greasy breakfast places.  You know the ones.  Coffee, tea & water are self-serve.  I like that.  A lot.  Our waitress was very sweet.  A little boy ran out into the gardens & one of the farmers gave him a little squash.  What??  Is this real life???  I didn't think places like this still existed but I am so happy that they do.  :)

ZVbQkJZSSYHL4Pvm7fl12w.text: I enjoyed the outside atmosphere with lushes trees, live chickens, and the lovely sitting wall. But I would only recommend this place for special occasions or times where you have all morning to grab a bite. The wait time was quoted at 30 minutes but it was really about 50 and the tables are not very comfortable once you're seated. You sit very close to the next table and the service is just ok- not spectacular. I would have enjoyed it more if they had additional shops or local stands out to look through! Beware of falling leaves while you eat though :p

IAQh-AmvGTNAMBX-qCYlCQ.text: Had the special of the day which was AWESOME. Really nice setting, you can walk around the gardens. Dogs are allowed so thats a huge plus! Worth the time to check out. Went with my family and everyone loved their meal.

d-tnRGg-JbgtCpD4bj-HKw.text: Loved the scenic restaurant, right in the middle of the farm. My #1 spot for a weekend brunch.

RAwEAvcOKGAJNK5v68pGLA.text: Beautiful outdoor cafe where I am finally okay with going somewhere filled with families and aren't bothered. Seriously though, PHX area is overflowing at the brim with families out to eat everywhere so it was awesome to find a delicious, fresh, local breakfast option where I wouldn't lose my mind over all the screaming children. While MGC does cater to families each table feels secluded and you can take in the nature and beauty of the farm, not to mention eat and chat in peace. Another reason for picking MGC is their use of local sustainable ingredients. As a vegetarian I think its really important to support local farmers so I am happy to see this trend picking up in AZ. I enjoyed the white truffle egg skillet with local veggies, it was phenomenal. Being veg I can sometimes get shafted by just eggs and toast dishes or the occasional bland omlette but this dish was so flavorful and full of deliciously chopped veggies (I know I saw some potatoes, cauliflower, bell pepper and green onion to name a few). I would considering bumping my fav breakfast dish 'eggs florentine' down a notch for this skillet.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White truffle scramble

ddG0b5pA6IJsSCuQAL2eFw.text: To begin, I really wish I could rate the food and the service separately. I would give the service a 1 and the food a 4. I had been wanting to go to The Farm at South Mountain for some time now and waited until the weather cooled down in order to go try out this place I have heard so much about. The organic farm, rose garden, picnic tables, shade trees, and the whole ambiance of the farm was wonderful. It was almost like we weren't in Arizona anymore.         As we approached the hostess she was clearly not the most patient of people. She stated that she was not going to wait long for people to come up to claim their table when she called their name. You practically had to run up there in order to get seated at your table, otherwise she swiftly moved down the list to the next name. I think allowing people a good 60 seconds to make it up to the hostess to claim their table sounds reasonable, don't you? To be fair, it was 12:30pm and I think they close at 1, but still...  She directed us to our table where we sat ourselves to view the menu. The server came over and promptly informed us that they were out of french toast, the Monte Cristo, and that you could not order bacon or sausage on the side. The only way you could get bacon or sausage is if you ordered an item on the menu that included it. Apparently they were almost out of that too! A bit ridiculous if you ask me. I ended up ordering the Blueberry Waffles which were absolutely phenomenal. The whipped cream on top was the best whipped cream I have ever tasted. My dining companion ordered the American Breakfast and asked for the eggs on the side, on an additional plate because he is allergic to eggs. Of course, the plate ended up coming out with the eggs on the plate with the rest of his food. Food allergies should be taken seriously. Obviously, the allergy note got lost somewhere along the line. I ended up eating his eggs, which were really great as well. I also tried the breakfast potatoes that came with his breakfast and found them well seasoned and very tasty.        My dining companion will not be returning to this restaurant. Normally after an experience like this I wouldn't either. I did really like the food & ambiance though, so I will probably give this place another try. I think I will come earlier so they don't run out of the french toast again! I really wanted to try that... I hope that I am able to revise this review in the future.

HpI5hFODp8KjxoAejT1MHw.text: I like the concept of eating at a farm.  And Morning Glory brought that concept to reality.  The food was fresh.  But I felt it was a bit overpriced.

__IcLTtIBTCIs-w-Sv5pTQ.text: I think a great weekend starts with a great breakfast., ideally including a mimosa.  And I've not found a better place to have breakfast than Morning Glory Cafe.  The atmosphere is wonderful. It's quiet, laid-back, and beautiful. Morning Glory is set on a farm property near South Mountain. I found it easy to forget that I was still in the middle of a major metropolitan area.  And the food is excellent. I had French toast with apple butter and pecans. The thick slices of country bread were soft but never got soggy with syrup. I also had some locally made sausage, which had a delightful hint of spice that really offset the sweetness of the rest of the meal.  I would definitely recommend this place, especially on a nice spring or autumn morning.

FF8h6t0varxkFf0h5ns4QA.text: Great place for someone like me who misses the farming community of rural Vermont.  Great breakfast options.  Downside?  Get your own beverages (Coffee, juice, water, tea, etc.)...

4zmaN8XEeo-Xz78DPWfDkQ.text: Best breakie/brunch food EVER! The food is great and the organic coffee is yummy. My Fiance and I are having our wedding at the Farm and specifically wanted a brunch wedding so that we could eat the yummy breakfast food.

iP8jHWw3WLgYMJJ8NIbzAA.text: Great place, totally didn't mind that it was a $40 breakfast for two (we had a mimosa, coffee and oj, which added a lot to the bill). If you dont' load up on drinks your bill won't be so bad. The food was exceptional and the atmosphere cannot be beat. So nice on a beautiful sunny day with 74 degree temps. Really gorgeous.  Go before 10 am on a Sunday or it will be totally crazy busy.  Overall a great place and we'd go back.

tVvm5V4umpTYfn9jIHtr5A.text: Not obvious where it's at from the road (it's tucked back deep inside where it says (Farm At South Mountain) on the sign.  Cool atmosphere, birds chirpin, dogs running around.  Get your own coffee or water.  Food is farmed right there so everything is fresh.  Had smoky apple bacon, scrambled eggs, homemade biscuit, and russett potatoes which was mixed with beans or something, but REALLY good flavor.  If your near sky harbor, ya gotta go to this place for breakfast!

6Dtd9lMtVzxAEX1Hv9VknQ.text: The reviews are pretty much right on. The parking across the street (don't drive in the ditch thinking it is the driveway), the long walk down the gravel road (something my Father would not be into), to the bark path and hard to read signage.  We went on a Thursday around 9am and shared the place with one other couple. I had the Monte Cristo Breakfast and it was awesome. My wife had the South Mountain Omelet and it was fresh and tasty. The goat cheese along with the salsa verde made the omelet. The coffee was luke warm at best. I asked our server if he could freshen it up a bit, he took it and threw it in the bushes. He said that is what they do on the farm. He returned with a fresh cup. The coffee is not spectacular at all, marginal at best. He was a good server with about 5 tables by the end of our meal. I am not a fan of the limited beverage selection there. I understand if they don't want fountain drinks there, but they should have an old time Coke machine for those that like soda. Either that or a self serve beverage tub with ice. All and all it was a good $32 breakfast. But not something that would draw me back again.

Z_FyA4GOM2Vys1yL7SENTg.text: 1. enjoyed brunch with mom and dog 2. a lovely morning place just gorgeous and wouldnt even know it was in this area 3.  got coffee while we waited for seat sat in the quiescence area. just lovely outside 4. side note have to come for dinner, drink by the fire pit outside 5. had mamosas and french toast, mom had bloody mary and spinach and eggwhite omelet--mine was awesome BLOODYMARY TOO SPICY and egg white omelet was bland-otherwise we BOTH AGREE WE STILL LOVE the atmosphere! 6.walked around and noticed SPA AREA, ART GALLERY, homegrown veggies, and even wine TASTING  party nov 22

m7mXQtn7AwgQOv0Aj_31ng.text: Breakfast burrito and French toast is where its at. Great friendly and fast service with quality food and super atmosphere. Yum.

pRmIu2xzr2_rMe56Nfwy8w.text: Good place but I am a breakfast lover and would say that it's worth going to but not the place I would make my regular hangout.  We came here twice in a three week span and had two very different experiences.  The first time was mid morning on the weekend.  Very busy as you would expect as it is very popular.  Don't necessarily park across the street and walk all the way up the gravel road.  There is typically a couple few spots right by the place so drive the gravel road and park.  The wait was an hour but we were ok with that because we wanted to try it.  We had the eggs benedict, over medium eggs and home made sausage, and shared the blueberry waffles with vanilla whip cream.  All very good.  The coffee and drinks you get yourself on the back counter.  The service was relatively good the first time even though you could tell she didn't want to be there.  The second time we arrived later on the weekend, still busy, but only a 15 minute wait.  Cool.  We ordered the blueberry waffle again, ham and cheese omelet, and the over medium eggs with bacon this time.  Get the sausage, the bacon was thin and greasy.  This time the server tells us 2 minutes before the food is delivered that they ran out of whip cream for the waffles.  We're like, ok fine.  I'll tell you what, they are much better with that vanilla whip cream.  The omelet looked like they ran out of cheddar cheese too because there was none inside and on top just a sprinkle, strange.  The server was a nice kid but absolutely didn't want to be there and wasn't attentive at all.  Not too mention the table was FUBAR'ed.  No exaggeration, if you pushed on the table table top with two fingers you could flip a drink over because it swayed a foot either way.  Nice.  Look, we were gentle with the table, didn't complain, just wanted the same food from the time before.  Not the case.   Also, don't forget this is outdoor.  So keep that in mind if you don't like the outdoors.  Very pretty area.

2U2K04ar6VNWuZnXrRSdtQ.text: Great atmosphere and good food. Local food. Great breakfast place.  My favorite thing that I had was the bacon.  Service was great and it was a nice day outside. I felt like I was walking into a family reunion. It's definitely a place worth checking out.

XMsPUgdU4setILp1Nj-O6g.text: Cannot believe that I've lived here as long as I have and this was my first visit to The Farm.  As they don't serve hot breakfast @ The Farm, they told us about Morning Glory Cafe and we walked back.  It is quaint and lovely.  Upon arrival at the desk, the gal said we could grab a coffee or water while we wait.  We killed a few minutes by grabbing coffee (half a cup) and waiting out front.  The food was very good -- my husband had the brisket & eggs and I had the omlette of the day.  My only complaint, and I can see several others have commented on this, is the casual manner in which they tell you about grabbing a self serve coffee.  If they can't tell you they will charge you for it up front, then it should be clearly posted as such at the drink dispenser area.  We would have never gotten a half a cup of coffee each if we had known it would add $6 to our bill.  This is a big no no and has a way of turning people off even when the overall experience was good.  Dear Morning Glory:  please post something indicating the cost of the beverages that are casually mentioned by your hostess.  This feels a bit deceitful.  Thank you.

ETfmbFUFJ-LSayiRnllqaA.text: Enjoyed a lovely brunchy meal with some darling friends. We have fun trying new places every couple of months or so .. and Saturday's  adventure was the Farm.   Morning Glory  is a great little out of the way place .Seating is all outside and the view is near Maya's Garden and Quiescence. It has that "local" vibe , people are streaming in in their hiking and biking  clothes, families with kids and dogs in tow seem to have been here before.   We were quickly seated passing by a waitress with two platters with the French toast / Monte Cristo type sandwich . Big enough to feed a family of five..Holy Guacamole as my 2nd graders say.  We settle in after getting ourselves  either tea, water or lemonade.. can't decide if i love or hate this... get your own beverage..  yeah I can get my own whenever I  want.... oh dang I got to get up again and get my drink ...  I ordered the South Mountain Omelet which has the on site grown veggies from Maya's . Heavy on the zucchini   light on the goat cheese, very tasty.  A small but tasty biscuit came with it.   Friend enjoyed their egg sandwiches and all were happy and content.   Light mental note --this is outside on a "farm/garden" there will be bright sun and we had a lot of flies. Off putting for some ..not us.   Cute little place definitely going on my take mom here list. I'll be back.

tyNnHccljsvkKZ45jke_RA.text: Came here for my birthday which was on a Wednesday in March. The weather was beautiful and breezy. There were some people but there were many open tables so we got right in. We also brought our little dog since we planned to go hiking after and wanted to bring her. It was nice to find a place to bring your four legged friend! Anyways, the first thing we noticed was the self serve coffee, water and lemonade. We actually liked this idea! The only thing that I had an issue with is that they don't mention that there is a charge for the lemonade. They really should have a sign or something that mentions this. While looking over the menu, we noticed that the trees above us kept shedding leaves which we really were not excited about getting into our meals when they arrived. The waitress was really nice and moved an umbrella over to shield us a little from the greenage dropping into our food.  I decided on the monti cristo (over easy eggs, ham, and swiss cheese sandwiched between french toast with maple syrup) and my husband chose the cheese omelet with home fries. The monti cristo was soooo good. The only issue was that I noticed pieces of paper packaging still on my ham. It wasn't very much but it was a bit irritating having to peel little pieces of paper off of my ham! My husband was not impressed with his meal at all. He said the cheese on the omelet was nothing more than velveeta, the biscuit served with his meal was grainy and tough, and the home fries were not very flavorful.  The prices were pretty high for breakfast and my husband said his breakfast didn't even fill him up.  After breakfast, we walked around the farm a bit which was cool. The only thing we noticed was that there were no signs up next to each crop stating what they were. I would have liked to know what each was.  To sum it up, it was a nice, peaceful atmosphere and I was happy that I could bring my little doggie. However, I didn't feel it was worth the price and being the fattie that I am, I really don't like to have distractions from eating my meals (leaves falling in my food, packaging on my ham...). I don't think we would go back unless our dogs wanted to go our for breakfast. Haha

wvnJWOlONuRvUfDwTttZeA.text: This place was awesome! A must try! I was visiting the area with my mom and we stumbled on it through a different app on my phone. I checked it out on here and saw that it seemed worth a try. Everything we got was so good we came back the next day again! They had some breakfast staples like Your standard bacon, egg, and potatoe breakfast but all the egg meals came with the most amazing biscuits! The potatoes were awesome too very well seasoned! They have some items that were a little out of the box as well such as the porridge we tried which was also delicious. The place was so good we went back again on Saturday. The wait was a little longer this time but again worth it. Both of our servers were very accommodating and the self serve drinks were good too for those of us who drink a lot of coffee or Iced yea. The last reason to try it out is among all the chains this quaint place was in a garden of flowers! Must try!

YAbb2MOxdLvD4qkvlO7Wug.text: They had us the moment we drove up the bark chipped driveway, through the arbor, and up to the patio with red checked table cloths.  the day before, we had breakfast at La Grande Orange, and my husband was sure I couldn't top that experience...but Yelp did not disappoint!!  I had the Monte Cristo....slow roasted Black Forest Ham, thinly sliced, and served with an egg-over (had mine over hard...it's a yolk thing) with swiss cheese and sandwiched between brioche french toast....delightful!  Hubs had a sausage omelet with veggies and hash browns....  To speak to the prices...I honestly don't think that paying $10-$11 per breakfast entree is exorbitant. Especially when you realize that they are serving food made from mostly organic, and all premium sources.There is a price involved when a restaurant stays True to a seasonable and sustainable food source, and I'm willing to pay a few bucks extra for "slow food" vs. fast.  the $9 Bloodies were a bit steep, but by the time I had mine plus half of my husbands, I was as happy as can be:)  Warning: only visit the Morning Glory Cafe when you have time to relax and enjoy....uptight people need not attend...be prepared to stroll through the Artist's Studio and Maya's Farm....we stayed so long we almost went to lunch at the Farm Kitchen!  We look forward to coming back for dinner at Quinessence next time we visit Phoenix.  Big love to Wayne Smith for creating such a delightful venue!!

r48e1TEf1-1i3x_f5lmXxA.text: All I can say is, "wow." 5 star food, 6 star location/scenery, just an incredible dining experience for a crisp, Sunday morning. Yes you have to get your own water/coffee and yes the service is a bit inconsistent. If you can't get past that, then I recommend Denny's. They're all over the place. If you can dig a relaxed pace in a very serene, almost bucolic setting in the middle of the desert with the best monte cristo I've ever had, then head over to Morning Glory. Can't wait to try the dinner restaurant.

ABQl1biULEbaMa0uXT1lHw.text: This place is too cute. It's a great date spot, it feels like you are a million miles away from the city. We didn't have to wait for a table, but if you do, I would take the opportunity to explore the farm. It really is a cool place.  I had the American breakfast and my date had the Monte Cristo. Both were delicious.  A couple of tips, the coffee/lemonade/tea is all self-serve from a table by the building, but it is not complimentary. So if you grab yourself a coffee and a lemonade for example you will be charged for two beverages. Personally I would prefer if they just did away with the self-serve table and had the servers bring the beverages like other restaurants.  It is outside seating so in the cooler weather the meals cool down quickly. Also, you may be pelted with leaves or twigs from the surrounding trees if the wind blows and get a friendly bird or two hoping for a bit of your breakfast. I think it is part of the charm of the place, but yes you may be picking leaves out of your hair as you leave.  Also, the bathroom is a little rustic. It's a step above an outhouse really. It is clean-ish for what it is but you have been warned.

-qzXnncXBgwqjZYzXhTcfQ.text: We traveled out of our way to go back to this spot while visiting family. Such a beautiful farm Oasis in the middle of a desert. And the food is so fresh and delicious. Will definitely be back a third time / every time we visit.

upt_hdakMlFx5b3pqLYavw.text: There is a lot of hype for this place but the breakfast was pretty mediocre and over priced for an outdoor only restaurant.  The menu has your standard breakfast items which include sandwiches, omelets, waffles, french toast. Although the ingredients are partly locally grown, the flavors are bland and taste similar to what I would prepare myself in the comfort of my home...and I could take it to my patio if I wanted to eat outside.  All items range 11-15 bucks. Drinks are all self serve which is a little annoying too. I usually like to be served when I go to a restaurant.  It's outdoor seating and it can get pretty warm. At least the tables are shaded but it's like 90 degrees in early April so it's not a very comfortable experience.  Overall Morning Glory is all hype. The food is not the quality of the Michelin star breakfast place as it is of price.  I guess I wouldn't come back unless the prices were more reasonable and the weather was nicer (like month of February only).   There are so many more unique breakfast/brunch spots in Phoenix that also use fresh products that I would rather visit.

QiwHlUgQ-QoOGq5o8v3V1w.text: Outdoor breakfast both charming and delicious with friendly easy going service.  This place can get slammed and they are only open during the bearable time of the year heat wise so make sure to call before heading out there!  Love the American breakfast and breakfast burrito, the eggs are tasty, the produce are fresh.  Go there to feel like you are in the country come back for the food. You can't go wrong with this place. Take a deep breath relax and enjoy... Yes the coffee and water is self service get your ass up you will be alright.

95-7htHdUH8RVQqNjihbTw.text: Wonderful little out of the way place. Easy to miss from the main road, but a treasure to find! The food was awesome! Fresh ingredients that taste so REAL (for lack of a better word). I would've given this place 5 stars IF they had inside seating, but they don't. Eating outside on a farm is nice, but the Arizona heat and farm flies, made me take away a star! Yes, there's plenty of shade, and they do their best to bust the tables quickly to keep away the bugs and pests.  The food tastes just like everything was grown right on site, as it should, because it is! The fruit was beautiful and juicy and sweet. The eggs were fluffy and delicious. The best was the waffle! OMG crispy but fluffy with the right flavor!   This place is a must if you're in the Phoenix area. Great service, beautiful scenery, and delicious food at a reasonable price!

Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CPTMl1Z0p9mnkyHLPaCz5Q.text: The surroundings are pretty and there is a ton of natural shade which doesn't happen much in Phoenix. It is a week day so this place wasn't very busy today (Thursday). Do not count on Yelps posted hours go directly to the website itself. Today it was only open 8-11am. Enjoyed our meal (also a very limited selection) we both had the pork omlette which was tasty and a large portion. The extreme amount of flies was kinda gross. If the manager/owner reads this I would suggest some measures about keeping flies away. For example there are plants flies don't like (basil, mint and tansy) that could be added to each table as a centerpiece. Just a thought.

photos.caption: Photo of Morning Glory Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dIFogwU0oRLNOucW7qB76Q.text: They overcooked my omlet eggs. The place is pretty but the food is nothing special. On weekends expect insane waiting times.

ZGuVuu5ZoLPgBqCXjjwf8Q.text: I am yet again a failure at planning anything so when my boyfriend asked me where I wanted to go for brunch when we landed early in Phoenix, it was up to him to save the afternoon! He quickly found this place and it looked 10x better than anything I had book marked so we took our rental car here asap.   Its kind of hard to find because its located in the back of the farm. There is no restaurant sign which is what we were looking for at first. There are a bunch of other restaurants on the premises but this was the only one that was busy the entire time.  20 minute wait on a Saturday afternoon. I think they messed up and let the guy after us get seated before but whatever. I grabbed myself an iced tea from the self serve section while we waited and shared it with my boyfriend teehee. The wait didn't seem long at all because we got to walk around the beautiful farm!   I got the farm omelette and he got the pork is the new black omelette because I refused to let him get the same thing as me. Our order took FOREVER to come out. People that were seated at the same time/after us were pretty much done with their orders by the time ours came out. I think they must've forgotten our order or something wtf. Bastards. Our waiter Dexter kept reassuring us our order was on our way though.    The biscuit was bomb! I am so happy our waiter offered us some jam because I pretty much loaded my entire biscuit with enough jam for the both of us. So noms. Totally worth the 500 buttery calories it probably was. I should've subbed the goat cheese in my omelette but I wasn't thinking. It came with cauliflower and carrots and all sorts of veggies I've never seen in an omelette before!   All in all a perfect way to start off our little weekend getaway in Arizona!

kHFXPxwwDKe8QZwxj3jHsA.text: Morning Glory Cafe has quickly become my new favorite breakfast spot.  Mainly because of its outdoor, fresh air, country feel.  The grounds make you feel like you are eating right smack in the middle of a working farm.  You can walk around the different areas, even check out gift shop.  There usually is a wait, but luckily it has never been more than 10 or 15 minutes. The tables are wobbly and the ground is hard to walk on in many areas (don't bring your heels or wedges here), but adds to the unique, agricultural yet homey atmosphere.   As far as the food goes, I have tried a few different dishes from the french toast, pork omelet, eggs Benedict, and American breakfast.  They are all delicious, I haven't had anything I did not enjoy. Love the lemonade, and the muffins are house-baked.  Try this place out on one of our many beautiful sunny Arizona mornings.   Tip- bring your furry friends, this is a pet friendly patio. Tip- good location for different group events, from yoga to weddings.

JuyNRRHhHvq2H1Axr-YjJQ.text: Wait time was horrible. Except the wait time everything is good. Food is good. Place is amazing. We live in North Phoenix so it's quite a drive from our place but worth it.

dlp9uAhI03R4uLaRbiLFgA.text: This beautiful garden cafe will fill you up in many ways.  Today after our Yoga practice within the grove/grass at the Farm we ended with a nutritious organic brunch.  Staff is passionate about their food and service.  Dog friendly, great gift shop and Maya's farmers market.  Will return again and again for Yoga and Brunch.

s_sZWk5_ifMdjXU4wIUIvA.text: We had a wonderful breakfast here! Friendly staff! Chicken Enchiladas were amazing! Love that the food is locally sourced! Our 3 year old enjoyed running around the grounds and checking out the chickens!  If your in the area this is a great spot!

V9xReAKTEZIiU_TFAtlGLw.text: Great! A little hidden gem! The Benedict is one of the best I've ever tasted!   Also cute to walk around while you are waiting for the table!

rezLR_bMBiPvtZBZQB5s5Q.text: This place is perfect for a romantic setting or a special occasion. Took my friend and mother here for Mother's Day. A very relaxed environment with live music and food is really good. Ate the "Morning Glory Cafe" for Brunch.

TNzgLORv_vh69ib6UjxQwg.text: Breakfast was awesome!  We ordered goat cheese, Turkey sausage and tomatoe omelettes along with the French toast.  O.M.Goodness talk about scrumptious!  Hands down best French toast I've had in ages.  Can't forget the fresh squeezed o.j. and champagne to wash it all down with.  Very nice cozy place, pleasantly surprised by the outdoor seating but nice to sit out with the fresh air eating the oh so fresh food.  There's also a dinner restaurant that I will definitely try the next time I'm in town.

wvUEVM8QKUhZAWcDX4hUqw.text: We ate here for brunch on Sunday.  My brioche french toast was the best french toast I ate ever had.  It wasn't to sweet or too dessert-y like some can be.  What makes this place so great is the environment.  It really feels worlds away from Phoenix.  Its transitioning into the cooler weather now so i like how they had the heaters on.  The only reason why I knocked off a star is that the prices are a little high and you have to get your own coffee and water.  I ordered hot cocoa just so I wouldnt have to serve myself.

BjJfrR-VR6Rt01gT59NpSA.text: Was here for a Breakfast Club UYE.  What a wonderful setting for breakfast.  Not many menu choices but we all found something to eat and nobody had any complaints about how it came.  Our waitress was very nice.  After our meal several of us strolled around the farm grounds.
